Reviews.Title: “No Romance For This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerrycAZ
Reviews.Content: I wanted to surprise my fiancé with the Hilton Garden's advertised "Romance Package" (see below). However, we didn't feel the love during our stay. The problems began on our arrival, about 8:30pm. Upon entering the hotel lobby, we found no one at the front desk to check us in. Despite ringing the bell on the counter twice, we were standing at the desk for more than 5 minutes before a male and female employee slowly sauntered into the lobby from the direction of the hotel restaurant. I'm standing at the desk, holding a printout of my confirmation, and the female asks without apology, "can I help you?" Anyway, she finds my reservation and says they will set up our romance package immediately. To their credit, by the time I retrieved our bags from the car and located our room, they had delivered a small tray with 6 chocolate-dipped strawberries and a chilled bottle of Mondavi white zin. The strawberries were delicious. However, the wine was NOT the romantic bottle of "sparkling wine" I expected. It also wouldn't have been our wine of choice, had we known we were getting wine instead of the advertised sparkling wine. The room itself was clean, but small, and I liked that it had a refrigerator and microwave. The bed was nice enough, but too soft for our liking. However, what made sleep the most difficult was the thin walls. While the neighborhood is quiet, we could hear every sound coming from the adjoining rooms. Thank goodness no one was having a "religious experience" that night. The next morning, I went down to get some of the featured Starbucks coffee from the free coffee setup near the front desk. There, I found myself waiting in line behind a couple of hotel employees, who were also getting their morning coffee. After enjoying coffee in our room, we went to the small hotel restaurant for our included breakfast. When I showed the courteous waitress our breakfast vouchers, she took away our menus and returned with a 4x6 inch piece of paper on which had been copied a list of the breakfast items we could order. The list included omelets, bacon/ham and potatoes. We were also invited to help ourselves to items from the continental breakfast bar. All 'n all, breakfast was tasty and adequate, if not extraordinary. We checked out with no further incident. However, we won't be returning to this property, and in the future will seek romance elsewhere. "Romance Package" (excerpt from hotel website) During your stay, you'll enjoy: In-room sparkling wine or cider upon arrival. Full breakfast for two in the hotel's designated restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: podoho
Reviews.Content: this is a nice hotel set back away from I-17 in a business park setting - clean, quiet, with a good breakfast buffet for around 10 bucks - well worth it

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in North Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: 2MoMyPa
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Hilton Garden Inn on Pinnacle Road in mid February. I think it is a fairly new hotel judging on the surrounding area. The rooms were comfortable and well appointed. The grounds and pool are very nice and there is a huge gas fireplace outside the bar area. The breakfast was fantastic with great service as you could order a la carte or serve yourself at the buffet. Great way to start the day. When we reserved online, the price with breakfast was the same as the price without breakfast so definitely take the breakfast. It was $10.99 each for the buffet. My only negative comment about the hotel was the pricing at the bar. I ordered 1 (regular Bud) beer and 2 Bailey's on the rocks and the bill was over $21 (plus tip). The Bailey's were $6 each and they seem to treat the 'rocks' as a mix since they charged $1.50 more for each drink. It is the first time I have had to pay for ice in a drink since a trip to Paris in 1991.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WSG34
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest HGI I have stayed in. Great design and very friendly staff. I stayed here for business and would stay here the next time I'm in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: klinebch
Reviews.Content: I stay here almost weekly and love it. It's new, clean, staff are always courteous, and it's very close to work. Fitness center has all sorts of gear (even if it is a little cramped), and it's only about a mile to good eating, shopping, etc. One of the best hotels I use!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and great service in North Phoenix!”
Reviews.Author: Shuttrrbug
Reviews.Content: Business required a stay in north Phoenix at the Hilton Garden Inn North Happy Valley. Arrival was most cheerful despite the late hour. Room was exceptionally clean. The king size bed actually firm! The complimentary breakfast was cooked to order, healthy and quick. This was my first stay at a Hilton Garden Inn. I will be back and recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “hi”
Reviews.Author: Sunni W
Reviews.Content: great site will use again. Needed to find a great hotel with a great price and found one thanks to this site.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hilton”
Reviews.Author: janieCrawleyUk
Reviews.Content: Nice new beautiful hotel . Check-in was a breeze . We had a room with 2 beds .Usual HGI room with fridge and microwave . We paid for Bed and Breakfast rate @ $ 10.95 each and it was well worth it ./Fully cooked to order breakfast .I had a lovely Omelette .There was everything else you would expect and the service was great . We sat outside on the patio with our coffee afterwards ,such a lovely place . We also used the pool before we left which had plenty of loungers and umbrellas . Just a few minutes away from all the shops aT Happy Valley with lots of restaurants .Close to the I- 17 too . We will be back when we pass thro next year.

Reviews.Title: “A really pleasant hotel in every respect, Hilton at its best...”
Reviews.Author: solotravellerCanada
Reviews.Content: I've now stayed at this hotel about a half a dozen times. It's very close to Phoenix Deer Valley Airport (only about a 5 minute drive away), and also very close to the big Honeywell facility. This is a relatively new Hilton Garden Inn, and in every respect, it exceeds the brand standards one would expect from a Hilton. The staff are pleasant, the rooms are clean and large, the internet is fast and free, and the hotel is nice and quiet - it is well set back from the nearby streets, and exactly 90 degrees off-axis to the nearby airport runways, so you never hear the planes. All in all, a very attractive, well maintained, and pleasant hotel. This is one of the most reliable Hilton hotels I have stayed at so far as maintaining Hilton brand standards is concerned. I highly recommend it to other business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice newer hotel; not much else in the area”
Reviews.Author: zzzzz28
Reviews.Content: Two-day business stay. Very new hotel and very clean. Limited restaurant offering and very few options within the general area. Hotel is in an area targeted for growth, so should become more attractive in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Missing the Little Things....”
Reviews.Author: couturegirl
Reviews.Content: I have been a Hilton Honors member for a looong time. Granted, I don't travel frequently enough to be one of their uppity-ups, I usually get free bottles of water when I check in. Not this time. When my family and I arrived in Phoenix, it was very late, so sleep was the only thing on our minds. In the morning, my daughter was "starving" so we headed to the lobby where I was informed that breakfast was an additional charge. Huh? Since when? Not that paying for her breakfast was any sort of issue, however, as an Honors Member (Silver) I haven't paid for a meal in a Hilton in ages. When I asked if they had my number on file I was politely told no, so up to my room I went to retrieve my card. When I returned to the desk, the young lady explained that I was now Blue (not Silver) and had no more points. No breakfast for us! Bummer. And no bottled water either :( LOL. Shame on Hilton for not telling me that they took away my points. And my color. Coming from the DC area, I knew that the heat would fry me like an egg, so it was off to run on the treadmill in the exercise room. Well "room" is an overstatement. It is an exercise closet with NO air movement at all. Half the time that we stayed there (6 days) there were a bunch of teenagers from a sports team that used it as a place to watch TV. I didn't even bother complaining, I pick my battles. The only thing that we really couldn't get used to was the water. Have you ever tried to rinse the water off of the water that's on your skin? You will at the Hilton. It's the water softener. What a nightmare. Shampoo bottles flying everywhere because they were "slickery"... Skin that doesn't feel clean... I will take hard water any day, thank you very much. As for the rest of it, it was ok. The hotel is a stone's throw from a nice area, and a breath from the eh, not so nice area. I didn't use the hotel pool or hot tub because my parents have a better one :) Oh, and one of the teenagers had a nasty open sore on her arm and was headed to the pool. ICK! The hotel was clean and the staff was nice, but there are no real "extras" here.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: mikayla73
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend getaway for our anniversary. We live in the Phoenix area and were doing a sunrise hot air ballon ride in this part of Phoenix, so we decided to make a weekend out of it. The hotel was nice, the room was clean and looks just like the pics on here. The bed was comfortable. We had a king bed in our room. There was also a desk/desk chair, arm chair w/ foot stool, microwave, small refrig, and flat panel TV. The bathroom was roomy, there is no tub (ok with me), and the shower is tiled in with a glass door. There was only one odd thing about the bathroom, the toilet paper holder was located under the sink (mounted there), so you had to lean over and look for them. It was just very odd spot. I guess they did it to not put a hole in the granite sink. The pool area is small, but adequate. The pool is heated. They do have a restaurant on site, but we didn't eat there. There is a nice little patio area with a gas fire place also. Good for sitting outside in the evening. The fitness room had nicer equipment in it. We didn't use the business center, but it looked adequate. They do have free wifi. The staff we friendly, however we did have one issue. We booked our first night on Expedia, then added two additional nights (through Expedia again) for a total of 3 nights. We asked on checkin to make sure they were all linked so we didn't have to check in and out or move rooms. We checked in around 6p for the first night and that person said that it was taken care of, but check with the front desk in the morning. I spoke with the front desk the next morning, and we weren't linked. They had to issue us new keys and said we were taken care of. The next day, we were locked out of our room and had to visit the front desk again and ended up with yet another set of keys. They said they had called us to leave us a msg, to let us know, but there was no msg. Plus it should have already been taken care one of the other two times we spoke with them about it. They were very friendly the whole time, it was just a minor inconvenience that should have been pretty simple to take care of in the first place. The hotel seems like it's in the middle of nothing, but there are tons of places to eat very close. Also a nice outdoor mall with a movie theater. Overall we enjoyed our weekend and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Should be for the price.”
Reviews.Author: ootanaboot
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly hotel. Good for business or families. We couldn't find anything for the price we actually wanted to pay in the area so we went a little higher and got a room here. Needless to say, for the price it was everything it was cracked up to be. We wanted to be in the area to be close to a friend. If you want to be close to downtown Phoenix, this is not a good location. Our room was near the elevator so we heard the bell all night long, but otherwise it's a very quiet place. Nice pool and hot tub. Didn't try the food. For an awesome breakfast go to Matt's Big Breakfast downtown - INDESCRIBABLY good food, mostly locavore!

Reviews.Title: “Reservations do not guarantee you a room!”
Reviews.Author: amb73
Reviews.Content: I had reservations for four rooms for the national championship game. Several weeks before the game, they called and cancelled my reservations. They said it was a glitch in thier system and they had to cancel ALL of my rooms. Don't think if you have a reservation that it means anything at this hotel. They did offer to help me find another place to stay...(by giving me a list of local hotels)! By that time, there were few rooms available anywhere in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: FunnTimesJustUs2
Reviews.Content: We were just passing through and happened to stop by for the night. We had a fine meal in the resturant and Justin, the bartender took fabulous care of us. He was very friendly and answered all our questions. He was just wonderful!! He deserves a raise! All the other staff were warm and friendly as well but Justin was just superb.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: lamama6889
Reviews.Content: During my last visit in June, it was a hard time in my life personally. I came down to the bar to be greeted by the most pleasant, welcoming, and friendly bartender I have ever met. She made me feel so comfortable I felt as if we'd been friends for years. I ordered some appetizers that were fairly good and during happy hour at 50 percent off what's to complain about?! Unfortunately, I came down this month to find this bartender no longer works there. I had a few complaints about my stay previously and this particular bartender was so helpful and assured me all of my concerns would be addressed. She was an absolute delight and one of the reasons I chose to return to this hotel. I think perhaps I will try the Marriott down the street as I know there amenities are pleasing, and the hotel is always in superb shape.

Reviews.Title: “Nostalgic, relaxing and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: RP96
Reviews.Content: Found the property to be mature but well kept. Great food, service and amenities. The food was especially good - great variety with artistic and unique menu, well prepared, good presentation and exceptional service. Overall, a very pleasant and relaxing time. Was a bit disappointed that the high-speed internet was not free, but would still recommend this property as the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Service Is Good, Cleanliness Is Ok”
Reviews.Author: HoustonCountryMan
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice and good for business or leisure travel. Room service is a option and the food is pretty good. The bar is also a added touch and bartender is awesome! Of course the prices are a little high but room service always is. The room only lacks in cleanliness, the bathroom had a little mold in the shower and the room was very dusty throughout. If the Hotel improves there cleaning staff this would a Great Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Beds”
Reviews.Author: RenoWriter
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel happily accommodated our early arrival, allowing us to check in at noon. Front desk staff was very welcoming and always helpful. The room was very clean, quiet, attractive and tastefully decorated. The bed was absolutely fabulous. We had the best night’s sleep that we ever had at a hotel. Seriously! We have a great bed at home but would have loved to take this one home instead. Parking was convenient and ample. They also had a nice gym, which was well-maintained and had an assortment of machines plus free weights. We chose not to eat at the hotel, but staff directed us to an area a few blocks away where there were many food options as well as shopping venues. It is quite a distance from the city center, but If you have reason to stay at this end of town I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel w/ all the service a business traveler needs or wants”
Reviews.Author: IMAJEEL
Reviews.Content: Tucked in the midst of business parks at what seems a very long ride from the airport, this hotel was a surprisingly good value with exceptional service. I highly recommend it for business and single women travelers who have business in the area. UPSIDES: - Staff goes out of their way to be helpful, it has good security, a super clean "new feel" to rooms and public areas, and a nice, contemporary/friendly business traveler vibe to guests hanging in the bar and restaurant. - While there's not too many restaurants close by there's mini-pantry for sodas and frozen meals(there's microwaves and refrigerators in each room), a very happening bar, free spa water and cookies in the lobby, a decent restaurant w/ good food and room service available. So, no matter what time you arrive you can eat and settle in easily. -The other services are comprehensive and good, too. Free wifi and morning paper, good gym, small but functional outdoor pool/hottub, business center and on-site washing machines for if you've been on the road for awhile. - I saw others complained about the bed, but mine was GREAT, and they may not have realized there's an adjustment on the mattress where you can make it firmer or softer on each side. I also didn't have a problem w/ the AC that others mentioned. Mine was easy to adjust and not loud at all - despite it being 110 degrees outside. POTENTIAL DOWNSIDES AND TIPS: - TIP: Ask for a room away from the elevator. My room was a couple down from the elevator hallway, but the "ding" on it is pretty loud and woke me up as others left in the morning before me. - My room had a large double sized shower only - I quite liked it. But, if you like to take a bath - ask for a room w/ one. Overall, I thought this was a great value for this remotely located place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but loud AC fans”
Reviews.Author: marieTX
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, located in a new, quiet part of North Phoenix. 20 min. drive from airport in off-hours. Friendly, helpful staff. Lovely, hot breakfast (eggs, pancakes, oatmeal) made to order with a great variety of fresh fruit, breads, cold cerals as well. Beautiful rooms, spacious baths ($10 per person but well worth it!!). Grill also serves dinner beginning at 5 PM, pricey so you might want to drive to other restaurants at a nearby mall. My only dislikes: Very loud roof fan engines outside an entire side of the hotel. Make sure you ask for a room on the side of the hotel facing AWAY from these fans, which sound like a freight train. Also, the AC vent outside the elevators do not work properly (or perhaps just not opened during my stay). Very hot when you stand by elevators. But overall, a great hotel at a great price!! And one of the BEST breakfasts you will ever have at a hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for business travel”
Reviews.Author: farmerswife83
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here. The staff was friendly. The hotel was clean, comfortable, and felt safe. The food was pretty good (although breakfast is not included). The only negative things I can say are 1) my air conditioner was fairly loud (but it worked, and in Phoenix in July, that's all that mattered!) and 2) I found the bed to be uncomfortable, but that's just my preference. It was a nice, new bed. All in all, a great place to stay, especially for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for single traveler”
Reviews.Author: sunlovingOregon
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a safe comfortable feeling for a single female traveler. It is above average for the price. I got a great senior rate. Adjustable mattress is an amazing plus.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDays
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for two nights while in Phoenix to attend a concert. We chose this hotel because our ride and friend lived nearby. It was clean and we found it to be quiet. Would have liked if they had gone down the hallways during those two days and picked up plates, glasses, etc. Comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “For the most part, an excellent hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: TxTrvlr88
Reviews.Content: Nicely maintained facility in a growing urban/mix area with a number of good restaurants close by. For the purposes of our visit, this was a very good location ... near baseball stadiums and close by I-17. Both the pool and bar area had outdoor fire pits that were very attractive and welcoming. The major "down" side was the restaurant, both food and service. I choose Hilton Garden Inns because of their hot "cooked to order" breakfast, but this one was very disorganized and subpar in quality. We were especially tired one evening and decided to have dinner at the hotel ... we would not do so again. This was the only disappointing aspect of an overall excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Got almost everything right”
Reviews.Author: abal15
Reviews.Content: Agree with the positive reviews. HGI got right most of the elements of good hotel stay. Dinging 1 star because bed was not ultra comfortable and Temperature control needed a Phd (In system mode, the temperature can be programmed for each hour of each week day and efforts of all the previous residents of the room had resulted in atleast 5 settings per day) Also, not all rate plans come with Free breakfast

Reviews.Title: “The Valley of the Sun is shining on this place”
Reviews.Author: Traveler16340
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. The hotel staff were as polite and helpful as one could ask for. The facilities were relaxing and spotless. The American Grill was a great way to start your morning with a tasteful buffet complete with a cook to order menu. I'm looking forward to coming back the next time I'm in the Phoenix area!

Reviews.Title: “Unsurpassed Value”
Reviews.Author: DaveLongBeach_CA
Reviews.Content: The employees of this hotel were like family. Several of us stayed at this hotel while attending the Marriage of a relative. The Restuarant was a great value, especially the "All You Can Eat" Friday Night Fish Fry. Clean Rooms, Quiet and Comfortable. We are looking forward to another stay in November of 2010 when another relative will be marrying.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Cutomer service”
Reviews.Author: caligurl23
Reviews.Content: I was there with my family, we occupied approx. 10 rooms, the "manager" was rude, un mannerly, impolite. She raised her voice several times to me and my family members when we wer trying to address a problem with our bills. I would not recommed this hotel to ANYONE, due to the staff. But otherwise a nice, clean hotel. get rid of her and it would be a "5" STAR!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice facility ~ Very nice extra touches”
Reviews.Author: vegashomes
Reviews.Content: We were in Phoenix for a weekend for our daughters' sporting event. My husband came across this facility, and based on photos and reviews we decided to book this hotel. We were beyond pleased with our stay. The room were extremely clean. (Even felt clean enough to walk around without shoes on, that's saying A LOT)......The bathroom was spotless. Nice added touches was delicious refreshing drinking water with a hint of orange......upon entry to front desk..Also, oatmeal cookies, Yummmm....In the evening they had a courtyard that had a nice fire under the stars.....We highly recommend this place! And would stay here again.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: bw0
Reviews.Content: Good: - Very New and Clean - Swanky Modern Design (allot of nice touches) - Okay Gym - When I stayed I had a really good rate for what I got (I noticed in Jan '09 rates are up, not quite the value it once was) - Hotel Restaurant is decent but over priced (par for the course) - Complementary fresh baked cookies at the front desk will kill your diet Bad: - No Complementary Breakfast - The area it is in is somewhat out on it's own (though that area looks like it is growing)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay !”
Reviews.Author: AvasmomLasVegas_NV_
Reviews.Content: I found this "oasis in the desert" late Sunday evening on 6/22/08. After many hours of driving and getting lost in the area of Carefree, AZ. due to my lack of preparation and not having my own vehicle with navigation (or a map) I found this quiet but lovely hotel. I was road weary and exhausted when I checked in after 11pm but was greeted with a smile by Amanda. I got what I thought was a great rate, $99 for the night. I bought some Visine and a bottle of Chardonnay in the shop next to the front desk and headed off to my 1st floor room after she had asked me what my floor preference was. Being so exhausted I had a bit of trouble with the a/c (my fault I didn't see the panel on the wall) I called down to the front desk and Amanda was at my door to fix the problem in a few minutes. Great service! The room was decorated in attractive subtle blue and earth tones with luxurious white down bedding. A large flatscreen TV that swiveled to fit any seating position within the room was in the center with a microwave and desk and a nice sitting chair in the corner. The bathroom was attractive and sparkling clean with a granite counter, extra towels and Neutrogena bath products. The next morning I stopped by the lobby for a coffee to go and met 2 smiling employees working in the breakfast area. I didn't get their names but they were quite friendly and helpful. I was sad that I had to head back to Las Vegas so soon. If I ever find a need to be in the Phoenix area again I will most certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton hits the mark - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MightyMick
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. Clean, sozy rooms. Excellent breakfast foods, free business center, pool and hot tub. This is a new hotel, maybe 7 weeks old. Everything is new and in great condition. All the staff was friendly and willing to help make your stay great. Will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, good economy for the money”
Reviews.Author: jaysonsmith
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new property so I figured I would be the first one to break the ice. I stayed that the Hilton Garden Inn Happy Valley for a few days while on a business trip. This hotel is definitely designed with the business traveler in mind, including a nice workout area, laundry service, bar and a single restaurant offering various dining options throughout the day. Overall I was very pleased with my stay, and would consider it above average when compared to other hotels of its type. The bathrooms were nice with stand-up tiled showers, and the rooms were spacious with a 40 or so inch high-def television. Free internet is offered throughout the property, as well as other various amenities. My one complaint would be the thinness of the walls - but I cant complain too much about it as this is not a 4 or 5 star property. There is a pool and jacuzzi but I did not use it due to the mild weather during my stay. There is also a nice patio area for dining / drinks alfresco. Overall though, clean place, good location (near lots of shops and chain restaurants) and good views.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Garden Inn Phoenix North Happy Valley
HotelInfo.Address: 1940 W Pinnacle Peak Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85027
